events.originalText: In Eng Foong Ho v Attorney-General, the Court of Appeal of Singapore held that equality before the law was satisfied by a "reasonable nexus" between state action and the object of the law.
events.subtitle: Eng Foong Ho v Attorney-General
events.headline: Singapore Court of Appeal: Equality before the law requires 'reasonable nexus'

events.originalText: Mikheil Saakashvili was decisively re-elected as President of Georgia in "the first genuinely competitive presidential election" in the history of the country.
events.subtitle: Mikheil Saakashvili
events.headline: Mikheil Saakashvili re-elected as President of Georgia in historic election

events.originalText: The Taiwan High Speed Rail opened, connecting Taipei and Kaohsiung.
events.subtitle: Taiwan High Speed Rail
events.headline: Taiwan High Speed Rail opens, connecting Taipei and Kaohsiung

events.originalText: The dwarf planet Eris was discovered by a team using images from the Samuel Oschin telescope at Palomar Observatory.
events.subtitle: Dwarf planet
events.headline: Dwarf planet Eris discovered using Palomar Observatory images

events.originalText: The Metropolitan Police arrested six people in conjunction with an alleged terrorist plot to release ricin on the London Underground, although no toxin was found.
events.subtitle: Metropolitan Police
events.headline: Metropolitan Police arrest six in alleged London Underground ricin plot

events.originalText: Sri Lankan Tamil politician Kumar Ponnambalam was killed in an assassination suspected to have been sanctioned by President Chandrika Kumaratunga.
events.subtitle: Sri Lankan Tamils
events.headline: Sri Lankan Tamil politician Kumar Ponnambalam assassinated

events.originalText: The United States Embassy to Somalia in Mogadishu was evacuated by helicopter airlift days after violence enveloped Mogadishu during the Somali Civil War.
events.subtitle: Embassy of the United States, Mogadishu
events.headline: US Embassy in Somalia evacuated by helicopter airlift

events.originalText: Georgian troops attacked Tskhinvali, the South Ossetian capital, beginning the First South Ossetia War.
events.subtitle: Tskhinvali
events.headline: Georgian troops attack South Ossetian capital, Tskhinvali

events.originalText: The Troubles: In response to the killings of six Catholics the night before, South Armagh Republican Action Force gunmen killed ten Protestants in County Armagh, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: South Armagh Republican Action Force kills ten Protestants in Northern Ireland

events.originalText: The bulk carrier Lake Illawarra struck a bridge over the River Derwent in Hobart, Tasmania, Australia, causing the deaths of seven of the ship's crewmen and five motorists on the bridge.
events.subtitle: SS Lake Illawarra
events.headline: Bulk carrier Lake Illawarra collision in Hobart causes fatalities

events.originalText: An earthquake registering Mw 7.1 struck Tonghai County in southern China, killing at least 10,000 people and eventually spurring the creation of the nation's largest earthquake monitoring system.
events.subtitle: 1970 Tonghai earthquake
events.headline: Deadly earthquake strikes Tonghai County in China

events.originalText: Waiting for Godot by Irish playwright Samuel Beckett, termed the "most significant English language play of the 20th century", premiered in Paris.
events.subtitle: Waiting for Godot
events.headline: Waiting for Godot premieres in Paris, hailed as significant play

events.originalText: In his State of the Union speech, U.S. president Harry S. Truman (pictured) announced: "Every segment of our population, and every individual, has a right to expect from his government a fair deal."
events.subtitle: State of the Union
events.headline: President Truman calls for 'fair deal' in State of the Union speech

events.originalText: Second World War: Australian and British troops defeated Italian forces in Bardia, Libya, the first battle of the war in which an Australian Army formation took part.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Australian and British troops defeat Italian forces in Bardia, Libya

events.originalText: Nellie Tayloe Ross was inaugurated as Governor of Wyoming, the first woman to serve as governor of a U.S. state.
events.subtitle: Nellie Tayloe Ross
events.headline: Nellie Tayloe Ross inaugurated as Governor of Wyoming, first woman governor

events.originalText: Antarctic explorer Ernest Shackleton (pictured) died of a heart attack during his final expedition.
events.subtitle: Ernest Shackleton
events.headline: Antarctic explorer Ernest Shackleton dies during final expedition

events.originalText: The German Workers' Party, the precursor of the Nazi Party, was founded by Anton Drexler.
events.subtitle: German Workers' Party
events.headline: German Workers' Party founded, precursor to Nazi Party

events.originalText: Te Kooti's War: After surviving a five-day siege in the pā at Ngātapa, Māori leader Te Kooti escaped from New Zealand's Armed Constabulary.
events.subtitle: Te Kooti's War
events.headline: Te Kooti escapes after surviving siege in Ngātapa pā

events.originalText: King Louis XV survived an assassination attempt by Robert-François Damiens, who later became the last person in France to be executed by drawing and quartering.
events.subtitle: Louis XV
events.headline: King Louis XV survives assassination attempt by Robert-François Damiens

events.originalText: Franco-Dutch War: French troops defeated Austrian and Brandenburg forces at the Battle of Turckheim in Alsace.
events.subtitle: Franco-Dutch War
events.headline: French troops victorious at Battle of Turckheim in Franco-Dutch War
